task.name: accum
task.shortdescription: Accumulate incremental calibration solutions into a calibration table (NB: ACCUM WILL BE REMOVED IN CASA 5.8/6.2)
task.description:
NOTE: THIS TASK HAS BEEN DEPRECATED, AND WILL BE REMOVED IN CASA 5.8/6.2.
Accum will interpolate and extrapolate a calibration table onto a new table that has a regularly-space time grid.
The first run of accum defines the time grid and fills this table with the results from the input table.
Subsequent use of accum will combine additional calibration tables onto the same grid of the initial accum table to obtain an output accum table. See below for concrete examples.
Accum tables are similar to CL tables in AIPS. Incremental tables are similar to SN tables in AIPS.

param.name: vis
param.description:
Name of input visibility file Default: none
Example: vis='ngc5921.ms'

param.name: tablein
param.shortdescription: Input cumulative calibration table; use \'\' on first run
param.description:
Input cumulative calibration table Default: '' (none)
On first execution of accum, tablein='' and accumtime is used to generate tablein with the specified time gridding.

param.name: incrtable
param.shortdescription: Input incremental calibration table to add
param.description: The calibration data to be interpolated onto the tablein file. Default: '' (must be specified)

param.name: caltable
param.description: The output cumulative calibration table Default: '' (use tablein as the output file)

param.name: field
param.description:
Select field using field id(s) or field name(s) Default: '' --> all fields
Use 'go listobs' to obtain the list id's or names. If field string is a non-negative integer, it is assumed a field index, otherwise, it is assumed a field name.
Examples: field='0~2'; field ids 0,1,2 field='0,4,5~7'; field ids 0,4,5,6,7 field='3C286,3C295'; field named 3C286 and 3C295 field = '3,4C*'; field id 3, all names starting with 4C

param.name: calfield
param.shortdescription: List of field names to use from incrtable.
param.description: Select field(s) from incrtable to process. Default: '' (all fields)

param.name: interp
param.shortdescription: Interpolation mode to use for resampling incrtable solutions
param.description:
Interpolation type (in time[,freq]) to use for each gaintable. Default: '' ('linear,linear' for all gaintable(s)) Options: Time: 'nearest', 'linear' Freq: 'nearest', 'linear', 'cubic', 'spline'
* When frequency interpolation is relevant (B, Df, Xf), separate time-dependent and freq-dependent interp types with a comma (freq _after_ the comma). * Specifications for frequency are ignored when the calibration table has no channel-dependence. * Time-dependent interp options ending in 'PD' enable a "phase delay" correction per spw for non-channel-dependent calibration types. * For multi-obsId datasets, 'perobs' can be appended to the time-dependent interpolation specification to enforce obsId boundaries when interpolating in time.
Examples: interp='nearest' (in time, freq-dep will be linear, if relevant) interp='linear,cubic' (linear in time, cubic in freq) interp='linearperobs,spline' (linear in time per obsId, spline in freq) interp=',spline' (spline in freq; linear in time by default) interp=['nearest,spline','linear'] (for multiple gaintables)

param.name: accumtime
param.description:
The time separation when making tablein. Subparameter of tablein Default: 1.0 (1 second)
Note: This time should not be less than the visibility sampling time, but should be less than about 30% of a typical scan length.

param.name: spwmap
param.description:
Spectral windows combinations to form for gaintable(s) Default: [] (apply solutions from each spw to that spw only)
Examples: spwmap=[0,0,1,1] means apply the caltable solutions from spw = 0 to the spw 0,1 and spw 1 to spw 2,3. spwmap=[[0,0,1,1],[0,1,0,1]] (for multiple gaintables)
